issues.description: Inconsistent spacing in port declaration - std_logic_vector has space before parenthesis in one place but not in another
suggestions: Follow consistent style guide for port declarations
issues.reasoning: Inconsistent spacing in port declarations reduces code readability and violates style guidelines. Line 10 has space before parenthesis 'std_logic_vector (ELEM_BITS-1 downto 0)' while line 11 has no space 'std_logic_vector(ELEM_BITS-1 downto 0)'.

issues.description: Redundant boolean comparison 'prev_rd = true' instead of using boolean directly
suggestions: Use boolean directly: 'if prev_rd then' instead of 'if prev_rd = true then'
Redundant comparison adds unnecessary logic and reduces readability
issues.reasoning: Comparing a boolean variable to 'true' is redundant. The boolean value can be used directly in the condition, which is cleaner and more idiomatic VHDL.

issues.description: Using inefficient for loop with conditional check to perform simple array assignment
suggestions: Replace loop with direct assignment: 'elem_array(counter) <= elem_in;'
The loop iterates unnecessarily and creates extra logic for a simple indexed assignment
issues.reasoning: A for loop is used to iterate from 0 to counter, checking if i equals counter, then assigning. This is inefficient as it creates unnecessary loop logic when a direct indexed assignment 'elem_array(counter) <= elem_in;' would be sufficient and more efficient.

issues.description: Changing from two separate if statements to if-else changes logic behavior for prev_rd signal
suggestions: Restore original structure with two separate if statements
Original logic: 'if rd = '1' and counter /= 0 then prev_rd := true; end if; if rd = '0' then prev_rd := false; end if;'
The if-else structure causes prev_rd to be set to false when rd='1' but counter=0, which differs from original behavior
issues.reasoning: The original code had two separate if statements: one setting prev_rd to true when rd='1' and counter/=0, and another setting it to false when rd='0'. The refactored if-else structure changes behavior: when rd='1' but counter=0, prev_rd is now set to false (via else branch), whereas the original would leave prev_rd unchanged. This subtle logic change can cause incorrect FIFO operation.
